channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2023040061
item.description:
Report E-2023040061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-07T00:29:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-10
  • City: URICH
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of DPX-377 PRO EXTENDER (UN1210) was damaged during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works (EW) to remediate the impacted surfaces. EW personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all printing ink impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023031329
item.description:
Report X-2023031329

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-07T00:29:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-23
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY A SORTER IN SORT AISLE-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS AJAR, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND SATURATE THE SIDE WALLS AND BASE OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

item.title: Report E-2023030553
item.description:
Report E-2023030553

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-07T00:29:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-15
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSL experienced a UN1993 "Brake Parts Cleaner W7340" release from a 5-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 3' x 3' area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged pail and impacted absorbents were placed into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2023030563

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-07T00:29:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: 1. X-2023030563 FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMEMNT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A STRONG SOLVENT ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-E. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT 1 OF 4 METAL 1-GAL CANS WAS HEAVILY DENTED CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT EXCESS OF 32 LBS. PER IN. ECT. 2. X-2023030564 FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A STRONG SOLVENT ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-E. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA TO BE PROCESSED.

item.title: Report E-2023030397
item.description:
Report E-2023030397

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-07T00:29:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-21
  • City: Springfield
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORTH AMERICAN COMPOSITES COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A truck driver punctured a metal drum of CORVE8300 - Vinyl Ester Resin with the forklift when he placed a pallet on the trailer floor during loading. He did not realize that he had punctured the drum before leaving the Tulsa, Oklahoma, facility. A few hours later, another truck driver flagged him down and pointed out that something was leaking from the trailer. Our truck driver stopped on the side of the road and called the Operations Manager. The Operations Manager notified the Vice President of Operational and Regulatory Affairs. He contacted Clean Harbors Environmental Services, Inc. ("Clean Harbors"), the designated emergency response contractor. A cleanup crew was dispatched to the scene. Clean Harbors will manage the disposal of the cleanup debris. What Failed Code: 104/Body How Failed Code: 309/Punctured Causes of Failure Codes: 515 (Human Error); 516 (Impact with Sharp or Protruding Object)

item.title: Report I-2023020109
item.description:
Report I-2023020109

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-07T00:29:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-07
  • City: Scott City
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When the railcar came in, we put our fittings and hose on. The valve was stuck closed. I called the shipper and got advice on how to deal with the stuck valve. Apparently there was frozen product next to the valve. We heated the area and the valve freed up. We were over half way finished unloading the product when the hose came off. The product came out really fast. It took a couple of minutes to get extra safety gear on in order to shut the valve, located under the railcar, right by where the product was coming out. When we tried to close the valve, it would only partially close, but not all the way. Some frozen product was stuck in the valve. We kept working it until it closed. The reason the hose came off was due to one of the cam Ievers coming off. This was due to the pin that the cam Iever hinges on falling out. I have seen these pins back themselves out some, but never all the way out like this. We replaced all the fittings and instructed everyone on the inspection of these hinge pins. The product is a thick product which we were able to contain in a flat area that formed a pool. We had a vacuum pump suck everything up. We made a trench to squeegee the pruduct to in order to get all of it sucked up. The offical clean up guys came in the next day and put the finishing touches on the clean up.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 15, 2023, at 2234 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal-XSL reported UN3267 "METALNOX® M6353" released 2-gallons on the concrete dock floor due to a pinhole puncture from a 55-gallon ploy drum. Terminal personnel utilized Oil Dri to contain the spill and placed the damaged drum on it's side. ERTS dispatched HEPACO to perform all onsite clean up activities. On February 16, 2023, at 0900 ET, HEPACO arrived onsite and confirmed 2-gallons of product released o a 5' x 4' area of the dock floor due to a pinhole puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The absorbent waste and PPE were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On February 7, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote containing phosphonic acid was damaged and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted surface. EWI personnel transferred the virgin product to a new 275 gallon tote, then utilized absorbents and hand tools to finish remediation. All phosphonic acid-impacted material was containerized in one (1) 275-gallon tote and one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Domicile Terminal XCU experienced a cargo release of UN3265 Bulab 7145 from a 55-gallon poly drum while delivering the product to the customer location. ERTS dispatched contractors to assist with cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to an 8' x 30' area of the trailer floor due to a pallet nail puncture. Oil Dri was deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. All spent absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was transported to XPO Logistics terminal located in Columbia, MO and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-gallons of product released to a 5' x 5' area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Oil Dri was deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into an 85-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED AT BOXLINE 3 RED HAZMAT PACKAGES PALLET WEARING APPROPRIATE PPE CONSISTING OF GLOVES W/ SHIELD LINERS, BOOTS, GOGGLES, AND APRON. UPON ARRIVAL, HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS UPRIGHT WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS FACING UP, SMALL PUDDLE OF PRODUCT (UN1903) HAD ACCUMULATED. RESPONDER NEUTRALIZED SMALL PUDDLE AND ABSORBED WITH ZEBSORB INTO SPILL TUB. RESPONDER REMOVED ALL MATERIAL AND PACKAGE TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO ABSORB REMAINING PRODUCT DUE TO CONTAIMINATION.

item.title: Report X-2023020145
item.description:
Report X-2023020145

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-07T00:29:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-01
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A STRONG ALCOHOL ODOR BY A SLIDE SORTER ON BOXLINE-5. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGED WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 2 PLASTIC 1-GALLON CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY A FULL ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 8 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE SIDE WALL AND BOTTOM OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XSL experienced a release of UN1120 "Ultrasolve L 1100" from a 55-gallon metal drum impacting the trailer floor and yard below. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately all 55-gallons of product released to an 8' x 12' area of the trailer floor and a 10' x 100' area of the concrete lot below. Crew confirmed the drum was punctured by sheet metal being shipped in the same trailer. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon metal drum. All impacted absorbents, cardboard, and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A FRAGRANT ODOR BY THE HAZ-MAT AUDITOR AT THE AUDITING STATION. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT ALONG THE CAP ASSEMBLY/THREADS AT THE TOP OF A METAL 5-GALLON SEALED HEAD PAIL THERE WAS A SLIGHT BREACH, CAUSING APPROX. 6 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK INTO THE BOTTOM OF THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF 4" OF FOAM PEANUTS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

  • Description: 1. X-2023010720 THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING AT 20:15 ON THE SORT AISLE D BELT, IN THE EARTH CITY MO UPS HUB. THE PACKAGE (A 16X9X13 IN DOUBLE WALL 275LBS BURSTING TEST FIBERBOARD BOX) WAS FOUND ON ITS SIDE LEAKING A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID. ALL MATERIAL WAS CLEANED, CONTAINED, AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. AN INTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE INNER RECEPTICLES (1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES) HAD NO PACKING MATERIAL TO PROTECT THEM DURRING SHIPPING. THE SPILLAGE WAS CAUSED BY A LOOSE CAP COMBINED WITH THE PACKAGE BEING ON ITS SIDE. ALL MATERIAL HAS BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE UPS DAMAGED MATERIALS PROGRAM. 2. X-2023010721 THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING. THE PACKAGE (A 16X9X13 IN DOUBLE WALL 275LBS BURSTING TEST FIBERBOARD BOX) WAS FOUND ON ITS SIDE LEAKING A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID.   • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE ON THE LID OF A 5-GAL BUCKET BY THE PRE-TRIPPER/SWEEPER IN UNLOAD. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG EMPLOYEE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE FROM RECEPTICLE), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED A SMALL CRACK IN THE LID OF A PLASTIC 5-GAL PAIL.

item.description:

  • City: ARBYRD

  • Carrier/Reporter: DOLPHIN LINE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 01, 2022 at 11:00 ET, Dolphin Line Inc. notified ERTS of a cargo release at 8301 MO-108, Arbyrd, MO. It was reported that an unknown amount of Counter20G was released from 40-lb Lock-N'-Load containers due to unknown damage during transit. The release impacted the inside of trailer #30176. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS dispatched E3 to perform the cleanup. At 1435 EST, E3 arrived on site and located the impacted container. E3 estimates about 0.25 lbs were released but the damaged box was on the bottom of the load, so E3 began unloading the boxes. Before departing the site at 1610 EST, E3 containerized the 40 lb leaking container into a 1-55 gallon drum to be transported off-site. Waste will be staged at the E3 shop located at: 816 Nesbit Rd, Nesbit, MS 38651 until proper disposal.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: certified admin made sure to wear gloves when handling the hazmat before transferring into a yellow drum.

item.description:
Report X-2022120425

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-15
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY A HAZ-MAT AUDITOR. CALLED FOR RESPONDER. AFTER DONNING ALL OF THE PROPER PPE AND FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAPS ON 2 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WERE LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING A TOTAL OF 8 OUNCES TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACHES AND INTO THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF CORRUGATED PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THERE WAS A SMALL 2" LONG CRACK ON THE BOTTON OF A PLASTIC 5-GAL PAIL, CAUSING APPROX. 10 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BOTTOM OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

  • City: SAINT LOUIS

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0935 ET XSL reported a 7-gallon release of battery acid from a large battery, impacting the trailer, due to the pallet beneath it giving out and the battery tipping over. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of battery acid released to the trailer floor in an 8' x 20' area as well as the concrete lot below in an 8' x 10' area due to the battery tipping over. Crew righted the battery and is wiped down the exterior, it was then re-secured for shipment on. Soda ash and oil dri were utilized to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. The waste was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

  • Description: This shipment exhibited an odor. Upon inspection of the contents the odor did not appear to be from the contents. However, the package contained: a) an It's a girl firework and b) smoke bombs, both fireworks. The shipment was not offered with any dangerous goods marks, labels nor with a shipper's declaration for dangerous goods. It is an explosive. Exact UN number and hazard class compatibility group not known. I notified the FAA via their email process and photos were sent. The package was held until released by FAA. Final disposition is expected to be picked up by the shipper or environmental disposal if abandoned. The shipper listed themselves as both the shipper and recipient.

item.title: Report X-2022120142
item.description:
Report X-2022120142

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-29
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO ELEVEN PACKAGES DUE TO FROST FORMING ON THE SIDES OF THE BOXES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING MRS FIELDS FROZEN COOKIES. SOME OF THE PACKAGES HAVE GREEN KEEP FROZEN STICKERS, PINK OR BLUE PRODUCT INFORMATION AND FROZEN STICKERS. HOWEVER, THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES INDICATING DRY ICE WAS BEING USED TO COOL THE COOKIES. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1Z63W4780197726172, 1Z63W4781398172406, 1Z63W4781398862214, 1Z63W4781394596046, 1Z63W4781393043859, 1Z63W4781394185061, 1Z63W4780194538532, 1Z63W4780194934943, 1Z63W4780191855963, AND 1Z63W4780191692577. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM AMERICOLD IN FAIRMONT CITY, ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 63W478, FUNDRAISE #21, 12154 DARNESTOWN ROAD, GAITHERSBURG MD 20878.

item.description:
Report E-2022120029

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-29
  • City: ARBYRD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Dolphin Line Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 29, 2022, at 1614 ET, Dolphin Line Inc. reported an unknown quantity of UN2783 "organophosphorus pesticides solids" released due to an unknown cause. ERTS dispatched E3 Environmental (E3) to the site to perform all onsite clean up operations. On November 29, 2022, at 2029 ET, E3 arrived onsite and advised the trailer was moved to the loading dock, the material containers were unloaded with a forklift, one damaged material 40-pound poly container inside of box was cracked approximately 3-inches in length and 1/8 inch in width located on bottom middle of the container. E3 estimated 15-20 pounds of product was released inside of the box and outside of the box onto the trailer wood floor. E3 collected and containerized the damaged box of the material and the material into a 55-gallon steel drum with hand tools, broom and shovel. All waste was transported offsite for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET/STAINED IN APPEARANCE. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG EMPLOYEE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1 FULL ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 10 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BOTTOM OF THE CARTON.

item.title: Report X-2022111044
item.description:
Report X-2022111044

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-08
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2022111044 FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET AND LEAKING BY A SORTER ON BOXLINE-3. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AD NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND A 2' RADIUS PUDDLE CLEANED UP, THEN ALL MATERIALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER ISNSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS CRACKED, CAUSING APPROX 2 QUARTS OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO, THEN OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF CORRUGATED PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT). 2. X-2022111045 FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY A SORTER ON BOXLINE-3. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPRX. 10 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. 3. X-2022111046 FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY THE SORTER ON BOXLINE-3. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTC 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION. PROCESSED THROUGH DMP. 4. X-2022111048 NO COMMENTS PROVIDED.

item.title: Report X-2022110211
item.description:
Report X-2022110211

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-03
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A STRONG ALCOHOL-LIKE ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND IN LESS THAN A MINUTE A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 8 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BOTTOM OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

  • City: Willow Springs

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 20, 2022, Landstar reported a one (1) quart of an unknown product, later determined to be Sodium Hydroxide Solution, released outside trailer #754076, impacting the soil ground at a weigh station. Environmental Works was dispatched to the location to provide environmental cleanup. Environmental Works personnel stated that approximately 10 gallons of product was released from one (1) leaking 55-gallon poly drum. The released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of trailer floor, a 2ft-by-2ft area of asphalt, and a 6ft-by-2ft area of nearby gravel. Environmental Works personnel overpacked the impacted drum into one (1) 85 gallon poly drum and they generated one (1) 55-gallon poly drum containing gravel and spent absorbents.

item.description:
Report X-2022110034

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-26
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE BY THE HVD PICK OFF. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG TURNED OFF SECURED THE CONVEYOR BELT, EVACUATED THE AREA, AND NOTIFIED IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GALLON JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 8 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE SIDE WALL AND BOTTOM OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XSL called in to report a 2-gallon release of UN3066 from a 55-gallon plastic drum caused by a forklift puncture during loading that impacted their trailer and the asphalt below it. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to conduct cleanup. At 0900 ET, EnviroServe personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 4' x 2' area of the trailer floor and asphalt lot below. The damaged drum was collected into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area and collected into a 55 gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 0618 EST, XPO Logistics terminal XSL notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that a 5 gallon poly pail of UN1760, Sure Klean Vana Trol was impacted releasing 3 gallons of product to the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched EMA to conduct cleanup. At 0725 ET, EMA personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2.5 gallons of product released from a 5 gallon poly jug due to a nail puncture. The release impacted the trailer floor in a 6' x 2' area. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and collected along with the damaged pail into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On September 22, 2022, at 1744 ET, XPO Logistics terminal XRO reported UN170"Bulk Kleen 655LF" released 1-gallon impacting the concrete dock floor due to improper loading from a 265-gallon plastic tote. ERTS dispatched Environmental Works to conduct all onsite clean up operations. Contractors arrived on-site and confirmed approximately one (1)-gallon of product released affecting a 5’ x 5’ area of the dock floor. Contractors transferred all salvageable product into a new tote and collected and containerized the cut-up damaged tote and all clean-up debris into two (2) 55-gallons poly drums of waste, generated for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2022091449
item.description:
Report X-2022091449

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-24
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND IN LESS THAN 1 MINUTE A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND SATURATE THE BASE OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ IN BURSTING TEST.

item.title: Report E-2022090797
item.description:
Report E-2022090797

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-01
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XSL contacted ERTS to request assistance with an ongoing spill of regulated UN3082 "Betafuse 640" Environmentally hazardous substances, liquid, n.o.s. (methylene bisphenyl isocyanate) that released due to improper blocking and bracing inside trailer #4638979. ERTS dispatched EMA to conduct cleanup. At 1400 ET, EMA personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the dock floor. The product remaining in the damaged tote was transferred out into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all debris into (2) 55 gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE.   • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING IN THE LOADING DOCK. THE PACKAGE (A 16X12X12 CORRUGATED DOUBLE WALLED FIBERBOARD BOX) WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM LEAKING A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID. AN EXTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED NO SIGNS OF ABUSE FROM THE SHIPPING PROCESS. THE SPILLAGE WAS CLEANED, CONTAINED, AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. AN INTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED CORRUGATED PARTITIIONS TO PROTECT THE INNER RECEPTICLES (32 OUNCE PLASTIC BOTTLES). THE CAUSE OF THE SPILLAGE WAS A LOOSE CAP AND LIFTED FOIL SEAL ON ONE BOTTLE. ALL MATERIAL HAS BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE UPS DAMAGED MATERIALS PROGRAM.

  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1059 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XSJ) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately .75 gallon of battery acid (Hazardous - UN2794) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor at dock door #8. ERTS dispatched Environmental Works to conduct cleanup. At 1300 ET, EW personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.8 gallons of battery acid released to a 1' x 1' area of the dock and trailer floor. The battery was re-secured onto the pallet for shipment on. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected. All waste was placed into a 20 gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE STOPPED AND SECURED THE BELT, EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-05
  • City: Joplin
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This box was dropped off by a customer who dropped it on the front counter and left. An employee noticed it rattled when they picked it up and was cold to the touch. The package was marked perishable. Upon inspection of the contents it did contain dry ice pellets. As the shipper had not offered the shipment with any DG marks, labels, nor an indication of dry ice on the automation label it is undeclared/hidden dangerous goods. This was reported to the FAA via their email process and photos sent on 8/5/22. The name and addressee of the shipper and consignee were preprinted as the same company; in speaking with the logistics manager they provide preprinted airbills to their customers for shipments being sent to them.

WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG DIVERTED THE PKG FLOW, EVACUATE THE AREA AND CONTACTED THE DMP. A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 2 PLASTIC 1-GALLON JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND SATURATE THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE 5 GALLON JERRICAN WAS FOUND IN THE TRAILER LEAKING OUT OF THE BOTTOM AND ONTO OTHER PACKAGES THAT WERE ALSO INSIDE THE TRAILER. THE MANAGER CALLED IT OUT AND THE ADMIN PUT THE HAZMAT IN A LINED TOTE PLUS ALL THE PACKAGING FROM THE OTHER PACKAGES THAT WERE DAMAGED FROM THE SPILL. NO ITEMS WERE DAMAGED JUST THE PACKAGING, THEY WERE ALL REPACKED AND MOVED FORWARD. THE JERRICAN AND ALL OF THE DAMAGED PACKAGES WERE BROUGHT BACK TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: THE 5 GALLON JERRICAN HAS A CRACK OR HOLE IN THE BOTTOM CAUSING IT TO SPILL OUT WITH NO WAY TO STOP THE LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED PACKAGING WERE CUT UP AND PLACED INTO LINED DRUMS ALONG WITH THE DAMAGED JERRICAN.

  • Description: THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING ON THE PD-9 LOADING DOCK. AN EXTERNAL INSPECTION SHOWED ONE CORNER ON THE BOX (A 12X12X12IN 44LBS EDGE CRUSH TEST SINGLE WALL FIBERBOARD CARTON) WAS DAMP AND APPEARED TO BE CORRODING. NO SIGNS OF DAMAGE FROM THE SHIPPING PROCESS. ALL MATERIAL INVOLVED WAS CLEANED, CONTAINED, AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. AN INTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED NO PACKING MATERIAL BETWEEM THE OUTER CARTON WALL AND THE INNER RECEPTICLES (1 GALLON PLASTIC JUGS). THE SPILLAGE WAS DETERMINED TO HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY A LOOSE CAP. ALL MATERIAL HAS BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE UPS DAMAGED MATERIALS PROGRAM.

item.title: Report X-2022080837
item.description:
Report X-2022080837

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-03
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A STRONG SOLVENT ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-D. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PACKAGE HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND IN LESS THAN A MINUTE A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE LID ON 1 OF 4 METAL 1-GAL POPPED SLIGHTLY OPEN, CAUSING APROX. 10 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND PRIMARILY INTO THE BOTTOM OF THE CARTON. THE CANS DID HACE PLASTIC CIRCULAR LID RETAINERS. THE INNER PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF QUAD CORRUGATED PARTITIONS ALONG WITH SHREADED PAPER DUNNAGE. THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS PER SQ INCH EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PARCEL THE POWER TO THE IRREG BELT WAS CUT AND BELT SECURED, THE AREA EVACUATED AND IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAIMED, THE SPILL (APPROX. 10" RADIUS PUDDLE) WAS CLEANED UP AND ALL AFFECTED MATERIALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. THE REMAINING LIQUID WAS SOLIDIFIED AMD CONSOLIDATED WITH THE CONTAMINATED DEBRIS AND PROCESSED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL UPS DMP DISPOSAL PROTOCOL. THERE WAS NO SECONDARY CONTAINMENT / OUTER PACKAGING.

  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 20, 2022, Landstar called ERTS to request to dispatch a remediation contractor to address a Novastat P50 + Emulse XT release in a Landstar trailer. Accordingly, an environmental remediation contractor, Environmental Works, was dispatched. Following visual assessment of the involved cargo, it was determined by Environmental Works that the involved release was from a slow drip from the nozzle on the leaking tote. Product contained in the leaking tote was subsequently transferred into a new tote and media affected, trailer components and underlying concrete, were properly addressed via absorbents. Waste is staged at Environmental works in Kansas City, KS until properly disposed of.

  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-D. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND IN LESS THAN 1 MINUTE A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE BOTTOM OF A 1-GAL PLASTIC JUG HAD A MINISCULE PUNCTURE HOLE, CAUSING APPROX. 8 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BASE OF THE CARTON.

item.title: Report X-2022071070
item.description:
Report X-2022071070

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-20
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING AN ALCOHOL ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-E. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PACKAGE HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 3 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THERE WAS A MINISCULE PUNCTURE HOLE AT THE BASE OF A PLASTIC 5-GAL HEXACUBE BLADDER, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE SIDE WALL BOTTOM OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBER BOARD BOX, RATED AT A 200 LBS PER SQ IN BURSTING TEST.

item.title: Report X-2022070704
item.description:
Report X-2022070704

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-02
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A STRONG ALCOHOL ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-D. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN LESS THAN 1 MINUTE A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 16 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE SIDE WALLS BOTTOM OF THE CARTON. THE INNER PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF QUAD PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT 32 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report I-2022100231
item.description:
Report I-2022100231

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-02
  • City: BUTLER
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ELECTRO BATTERY MANUFACTURING CO INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A speeding car came into the lane of our driver. Our driver slowed down and tried to move over to avoid the car and there wasn't a shoulder. Our driver's tire caught in the mud and dirt and stuck causing him to be unable to correct himself back onto the road. Thus, causing him to flip over his truck. None of the load came out of the truck but did shift within. A tow company was called to upright and move the truck back to the tow company's lot. East Penn employees went to the lot to repalletize the load for shipment and neutralize and clean the truck. The batteries were taken back to the East Penn, MAryland Heights, MO facility before being shipped to East Penn, Lyon Station, PA to our secondary lead smelter. The incident truck was moved to Penske waiting for disposition. No injuries to the driver.

item.title: Report X-2022070624
item.description:
Report X-2022070624

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-29
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE BY THE SWEEPER ON THE PD-1. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT 1 OF 4 AMBER GLASS 4 LITER LABORATORY BOTTLES WAS SHATTERED,SATURATING THE CARTON AND THE PACKING MATERIAL. THIS INTERNAL MATERIAL CONSISTED OF A QUAD MOLDED FIBERBOARD ENCAPSULATING PARTITION, INCLUDING TOP BOTTOM PROTECTION. THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 48 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2022070606
item.description:
Report X-2022070606

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-28
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY THE LVD PICK OFF ON THE PD-4. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE TURNED OFF SECURED THE CONVEYOR BELT, EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR, DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT 1 OF 2 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS HAD A LARGE PUNCTURE HOLE TOWARD THE TOP OF THE RECEPTICLE, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND SATURATE THE CARTON. IT APPEARED THAT THE BREACH RESULTED FROM PENETRATION OF A SHARP/PROTRUDING OBJECT. THE INNER PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF A CORRUGATED SEPERATOR AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST

item.description:
Report X-2022070057

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-24
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE BY THE AREA SUPERVISOR ON THE PD-9. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED THE DMP. A RESPONDER ARRIVED IN LESS THAN 1 MINUTE, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON, THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER NSPECTION REVEALED THAT 4 OF 4 PAINT CANS WITH CLIPS WERE DENTED TOWARD THE TOPS OF THE RECEPTICLES, CREATING BREACHES THAT CAUSED APPROX. 16 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH AND INTO THE CARTON. THE INNER PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF DOUBLEWALL CORRUGATED PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS/IN BURSTING TEST.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON OUR LOADING DOCK NEXT TO THE IC BELT LEAKING. OUR TRAINED ADMIN PUT THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE HAZ CAGE SINCE THERE WERE CLEAR MARKINGS ON THE PACKAGE TO INDICATE IT WAS A HAZMAT. DescribePack: WHEN INSPECTING THE PACKAGE FOUND THAT ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD THE LID COME LOOSE CAUSING IT TO ACTIVELY LEAK OUT INTO THE PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE BOTTLES WERE SEPARATED INTO TWO DIFFERENT DRUMS ONE WITH THE DAMAGED PORTION PLUS THE PACKAGING THAT IT SPILT IN. THE OTHER UNDAMAGED BOTTLES WERE PLACED IN A DIFFERENT DRUM SO THEY MAY GO BACK TO THE SHIPPER IF PERMITTED.

item.title: Report X-2022060559
item.description:
Report X-2022060559

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-18
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A SOLVENT-LIKE ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN LESS THAN A MINUTE A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON A NON-HAZARDOUS PRODUCT AS PART OF A MULTI-PRODUCT SHIPMENT WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 10 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

item.title: Report X-2022060198
item.description:
Report X-2022060198

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-04
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-D. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN A MINUTE A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAPS ON 2 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WERE LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING A TOTAL OF 12 OUNCES TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACHES AND INTO THE BASE AND SIDE WALLS OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/INCH EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2022051160
item.description:
Report X-2022051160

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-20
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD-E. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND A 2 FOOT RADIUS PUDDLE RESULTING FROM THE SPILL CLEANED UP. THEN ALL DAMAGED CONTAMINATED MATERIALS WERE CONSOLIDATED AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1 GALLON JUGS HAD POPPED COMPLETELY OFF OF THE RECEPTACLE, CAUSING MOST OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BASE OF THE CARTON, AS WELL AS ONTO THE FLOOR OF THE TRAILER. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER CONTAINER. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2022050595
item.description:
Report X-2022050595

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-06
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING ON THE FLOOR OF THE UNLOAD DOCK E IN THE UPS EARTH CITY, MO HUB. AT 20:00 THE PACKAGE (A 12X12X12 INCH 275LBS BURSTING TEST DOUBLE WALL FIBERBOARD BOX) WAS FOUND ON ITS SIDE ON THE FLOOR WET AND DISCOLORED FROM THE SPILLAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP CAGE FOR PROCESSING. AN EXTERNAL INSPECTION SHOWED NO SIGNS OF ABUSE FROM THE SHIPPING PROCESS. THE INTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THERE WAS ENOUGH PACKING MATERIAL TO PROTECT THE INNER RECEPTACLES (1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES) FROM THE SHIPPING PROCESS. THE SPILLAGE WAS DETERMINED TO HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY A COMBINATION OF A LOOSE CAP AND THE PACKAGE BEING ON ITS SIDE. ALL MATERIAL HAS BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE UPS DAMAGED MATERIALS PROGRAM.

item.title: Report X-2022050594
item.description:
Report X-2022050594

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-06
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY THE LVD PICK-OFF ON THE PD-3. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE TURNED OFF AND SECURED THE CONVEYOR BELT, EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GALLON JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 10 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE SIDES BOTTOM OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/INCH EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).
